members.name: generateAutomaticRanges
members.desc:
Whether the index should automatically create range values.

Tip: If you set this parameter to true, you should ensure that the ['Use cache for numeric queries' option](https://docs.coveo.com/en/1982/#use-cache-for-numeric-queries) is enabled for this facet's field in your index in order to speed up automatic range evaluation.

members.name: currentValues
members.desc:
The values displayed by the facet in the search interface at the moment of the request.

If `generateAutomaticRanges` is false, values must be specified. If `generateAutomaticRanges` is true, automatic ranges are going to be appended after the specified values.

Minimum: `0`

Minimum: `1`

The value `"equiprobable"` generates facet ranges which vary in size but have a more balanced number of results within each range.

members.desc: The amount of time to wait before selecting the result after calling `beginDelayedSelect`.

returnType.name: InteractiveResult
returnType.desc: The `InteractiveResult` controller provides an interface for triggering desirable side effects, such as logging UA events to the Coveo Platform, when a user selects a query result.

members.name: beginDelayedSelect
members.desc:
Prepares to select the result after a certain delay, sending analytics if it was never selected before.

In a DOM context, it's recommended to call this method on the `touchstart` event.

members.name: cancelPendingSelect
members.desc:
Cancels the pending selection caused by `beginDelayedSelect`.

In a DOM context, it's recommended to call this method on the `touchend` event.

members.name: select
members.desc:
Selects the result, logging a UA event to the Coveo Platform if the result wasn't selected before.

In a DOM context, it's recommended to call this method on all of the following events: * `contextmenu` * `click` * `mouseup` * `mousedown`

members.name: absentTerms
members.desc: The basic query expression terms which this query result item does not match. Note: This property is populated by terms from the query pipeline-processed q value (not from the original q value).

members.name: clickUri
members.desc: The hyperlinkable item URI. Notes: Use the clickUri value when you want to create hyperlinks to the item, rather than the uri or printableUri value.

members.name: excerpt
members.desc: The contextual excerpt generated for the item (see the excerptLength query parameter).

members.name: excerptHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item excerpt string.

members.name: firstSentences
members.desc: The first sentences retrieved from the item (see the retrieveFirstSentences query parameter).

members.name: firstSentencesHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item firstSentences string.

members.name: flags
members.desc: The flags that are set on the item by the index. Distinct values are separated by semicolons.

members.name: hasHtmlVersion
members.desc: Whether the index contains an HTML version of this item.

members.name: isRecommendation
members.desc: Whether the item score was boosted as a Coveo ML recommendation.

members.name: isTopResult
members.desc: Whether the item score was boosted by a featured result rule in the query pipeline.

members.name: percentScore
members.desc: The item ranking score expressed as a percentage (see the sortCriteria and rankingFunctions query parameters).

members.name: printableUri
members.desc: The human readable item URI. Note: Avoid using the printableUri value to create hyperlinks to the item. Use the clickUri value instead.

members.name: printableUriHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item printableUri string.

members.name: rankingInfo
members.desc: The raw debug information generated by the index to detail how the item was ranked. This property is null unless the debug query parameter is set to true.

members.name: raw
members.desc: The values of the fields which were retrieved for this item (see the fieldsToInclude and fieldsToExclude query parameters).

members.name: score
members.desc: The total ranking score computed for the item (see the sortCriteria and rankingFunctions query parameters).

members.name: summary
members.desc: The item summary (see the summaryLength query parameter).

members.name: summaryHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item summary string.

members.name: title
members.desc: Contains the title of the item.

members.name: titleHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item title string.

members.name: uniqueId
members.desc: The unique item identifier. You should consider the uniqueId value as an opaque string.

members.name: uri
members.desc: The item URI. Notes: Avoid using the uri value to create hyperlinks to the item. Use the clickUri value instead.

members.name: rankingModifier
members.desc: If applicable, represents the type of ranking modification that was applied to this result.

members.name: length
members.desc: The length of the offset.

members.name: offset
members.desc: The 0 based offset inside the string where the highlight should start.

members.name: [key: string]
members.desc: Custom keys that depend on the documents in the index.

members.name: configuration
members.desc: The search engine configuration options.

members.name: search
members.desc: The global headless engine configuration options specific to the SearchAPI.

members.name: locale
members.desc:
The locale of the current user. Must comply with IETFs BCP 47 definition: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt.

Notes: Coveo Machine Learning models use this information to provide contextually relevant output. Moreover, this information can be referred to in query expressions and QPL statements by using the $locale object.

members.name: pipeline
members.desc: Specifies the name of the query pipeline to use for the query. If not specified, the default query pipeline will be used.

members.name: preprocessFacetSearchResponseMiddleware
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a facet-search response before the state is updated.

members.name: preprocessQuerySuggestResponseMiddleware
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a query-suggest response before the state is updated.

members.name: preprocessSearchResponseMiddleware
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a search response before the state is updated.

members.name: searchHub
members.desc: The first level of origin of the request, typically the identifier of the graphical search interface from which the request originates. Coveo Machine Learning models use this information to provide contextually relevant output. Notes: This parameter will be overridden if the search request is authenticated by a search token that enforces a specific searchHub. When logging a Search usage analytics event for a query, the originLevel1 field of that event should be set to the value of the searchHub search request parameter.

members.name: accessToken
members.desc: The access token to use to authenticate requests against the Coveo Cloud endpoints. Typically, this will be an API key or search token that grants the privileges to execute queries and push usage analytics data in the target Coveo Cloud organization.

members.name: organizationId
members.desc: The unique identifier of the target Coveo Cloud organization (e.g., `mycoveocloudorganizationg8tp8wu3`)

members.name: analytics
members.desc: Allows configuring options related to analytics.

members.name: analyticsClientMiddleware
members.desc: analyticsClientMiddleware allows to hook into an analytics event payload before it is sent to the Coveo platform.

members.name: enabled
members.desc:
Specifies if usage analytics tracking should be enabled.

By default, all analytics events will be logged.

members.name: originLevel2
members.desc:
Origin level 2 is a usage analytics event metadata whose value should typically be the name/identifier of the tab from which the usage analytics event originates.

When logging a Search usage analytics event, originLevel2 should always be set to the same value as the corresponding tab (parameter) Search API query parameter so Coveo Machine Learning models function properly, and usage analytics reports and dashboards are coherent.

This value is optional, and will automatically try to resolve itself from the tab search parameter.

members.name: originLevel3
members.desc:
Origin level 3 is a usage analytics event metadata whose value should typically be the URL of the page that linked to the search interface thats making the request.

When logging a Search usage analytics event, originLevel3 should always be set to the same value as the corresponding referrer Search API query parameter so usage analytics reports and dashboards are coherent.

This value is optional, and will automatically try to resolve itself from the referrer search parameter.

members.name: runtimeEnvironment
members.desc: Optional analytics runtime environment, this is needed for analytics to work correctly if you're running outside of a browser. See https://github.com/coveo/coveo.analytics.js for more info.

members.name: name
members.desc: The Engine name (e.g., myEngine). Specifying your Engine name will help in debugging when using an application with multiple Redux stores.

members.name: platformUrl
members.desc: The Plaform URL to use. (e.g., https://platform.cloud.coveo.com) The platformUrl() helper method can be useful to know what url is available.

members.name: preprocessRequest
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a Platform request before it is sent.

members.desc: The flags that are set on the item by the index. Distinct values are separated by semicolons.

members.name: hasHtmlVersion
members.desc: Whether the index contains an HTML version of this item.

members.name: isRecommendation
members.desc: Whether the item score was boosted as a Coveo ML recommendation.

members.name: isTopResult
members.desc: Whether the item score was boosted by a featured result rule in the query pipeline.

members.name: percentScore
members.desc: The item ranking score expressed as a percentage (see the sortCriteria and rankingFunctions query parameters).

members.name: printableUri
members.desc: The human readable item URI. Note: Avoid using the printableUri value to create hyperlinks to the item. Use the clickUri value instead.

members.name: rankingInfo
members.desc: The raw debug information generated by the index to detail how the item was ranked. This property is null unless the debug query parameter is set to true.

members.name: raw
members.desc: The values of the fields which were retrieved for this item (see the fieldsToInclude and fieldsToExclude query parameters).

members.name: score
members.desc: The total ranking score computed for the item (see the sortCriteria and rankingFunctions query parameters).

members.name: summary

members.name: summaryHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item summary string.

members.name: title
members.desc: Contains the title of the item.

members.name: titleHighlights
members.desc: The length and offset of each word to highlight in the item title string.

members.name: uniqueId
members.desc: The unique item identifier. You should consider the uniqueId value as an opaque string.

members.name: uri
members.desc: The item URI. Notes: Avoid using the uri value to create hyperlinks to the item. Use the clickUri value instead.

members.desc: If applicable, represents the type of ranking modification that was applied to this result.

initializer.name: buildRecommendationEngine

members.name: configuration
members.desc: The recommendation engine configuration options.

members.name: pipeline
members.desc: Specifies the name of the query pipeline to use for the query. If not specified, the default query pipeline will be used.

members.name: searchHub
members.desc: The first level of origin of the request, typically the identifier of the graphical search interface from which the request originates. Coveo Machine Learning models use this information to provide contextually relevant output. Notes: This parameter will be overridden if the search request is authenticated by a search token that enforces a specific searchHub. When logging a Search usage analytics event for a query, the originLevel1 field of that event should be set to the value of the searchHub search request parameter.

members.name: accessToken
members.desc: The access token to use to authenticate requests against the Coveo Cloud endpoints. Typically, this will be an API key or search token that grants the privileges to execute queries and push usage analytics data in the target Coveo Cloud organization.

members.name: organizationId
members.desc: The unique identifier of the target Coveo Cloud organization (e.g., `mycoveocloudorganizationg8tp8wu3`)

members.name: analytics
members.desc: Allows configuring options related to analytics.

members.name: analyticsClientMiddleware
members.desc: analyticsClientMiddleware allows to hook into an analytics event payload before it is sent to the Coveo platform.

members.name: enabled
members.desc:
Specifies if usage analytics tracking should be enabled.

By default, all analytics events will be logged.

members.name: originLevel2
members.desc:
Origin level 2 is a usage analytics event metadata whose value should typically be the name/identifier of the tab from which the usage analytics event originates.

When logging a Search usage analytics event, originLevel2 should always be set to the same value as the corresponding tab (parameter) Search API query parameter so Coveo Machine Learning models function properly, and usage analytics reports and dashboards are coherent.

This value is optional, and will automatically try to resolve itself from the tab search parameter.

members.name: originLevel3
members.desc:
Origin level 3 is a usage analytics event metadata whose value should typically be the URL of the page that linked to the search interface thats making the request.

When logging a Search usage analytics event, originLevel3 should always be set to the same value as the corresponding referrer Search API query parameter so usage analytics reports and dashboards are coherent.

This value is optional, and will automatically try to resolve itself from the referrer search parameter.

members.name: runtimeEnvironment
members.desc: Optional analytics runtime environment, this is needed for analytics to work correctly if you're running outside of a browser. See https://github.com/coveo/coveo.analytics.js for more info.

members.name: name
members.desc: The Engine name (e.g., myEngine). Specifying your Engine name will help in debugging when using an application with multiple Redux stores.

members.name: platformUrl
members.desc: The Plaform URL to use. (e.g., https://platform.cloud.coveo.com) The platformUrl() helper method can be useful to know what url is available.

members.name: preprocessRequest
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a Platform request before it is sent.

members.name: renewAccessToken
members.desc: A function that fetches a new access token. The function must return a Promise that resolves to a string (the new access token).

members.name: loggerOptions
members.desc: The logger options.

members.name: browserPostLogHook
members.desc: Function which will be called after writing the log message in the browser.

members.name: level
members.desc: By default, is set to `warn`.

members.name: logFormatter
members.desc: Changes the shape of the log object. This function will be called every time one of the log methods (such as `.info`) is called. All arguments passed to the log method, except the message, will be pass to this function. By default it does not change the shape of the log object.

members.name: middlewares
members.desc: List of additional middlewares. A middleware is a higher-order function that composes a dispatch function to return a new dispatch function. It is useful for logging actions, performing side effects like routing, or turning an asynchronous API call into a series of synchronous actions.

members.desc: The Plaform URL to use. (e.g., https://platform.cloud.coveo.com) The platformUrl() helper method can be useful to know what url is available.

members.name: preprocessRequest
members.desc: Allows for augmenting a Platform request before it is sent.

members.name: renewAccessToken
members.desc: A function that fetches a new access token. The function must return a Promise that resolves to a string (the new access token).

members.name: loggerOptions
members.desc: The logger options.

members.name: browserPostLogHook
members.desc: Function which will be called after writing the log message in the browser.

members.name: level
members.desc: By default, is set to `warn`.

members.name: logFormatter
members.desc: Changes the shape of the log object. This function will be called every time one of the log methods (such as `.info`) is called. All arguments passed to the log method, except the message, will be pass to this function. By default it does not change the shape of the log object.

members.name: middlewares
members.desc: List of additional middlewares. A middleware is a higher-order function that composes a dispatch function to return a new dispatch function. It is useful for logging actions, performing side effects like routing, or turning an asynchronous API call into a series of synchronous actions.

members.name: (call)
preloadedState
members.desc: The initial headless state. You may optionally specify it to hydrate the state from the server in universal apps, or to restore a previously serialized user session.

returnType.name: ProductRecommendationEngine
returnType.desc: The engine for powering production recommendation experiences.

members.name: dispatch
members.desc: Dispatches an action directly. This is the only way to trigger a state change. Each headless controller dispatches its own actions.

members.name: logger
members.desc: The logger instance used by headless.

members.name: state
members.desc: The complete headless state tree.

members.name: store
members.desc: The redux store.

members.name: addReducers

params.name: reducers
params.desc: An object containing the reducers to attach to the engine.

members.desc: Adds the specified reducers to the store.

members.name: disableAnalytics
members.desc: Disable analytics tracking

members.name: enableAnalytics
members.desc: Enable analytics tracking

members.name: subscribe

params.name: listener
params.desc: A callback to be invoked on every dispatch.

returnType.name: returnType
returnType.desc: A function to remove this change listener.

members.desc: Adds a change listener. It will be called any time an action is dispatched, and some part of the state tree may potentially have changed. You may then access the new `state`.

initializer.desc: Creates a product recommendation engine instance.
